articles.title: For Some Reason, Trump's Education Secretary Can't Pronounce ‘AI' Correctly
articles.summary: McMahon made a few mistakes during her speech at the summit on artificial intelligence earlier this week. She mispronounced the word AI as 'A1' instead of 'they lie'. Last month, she admitted in an interview with Laura Ingraham that she is not aware of the meaning of key acronyms.

articles.title: For Some Reason, Trump's Education Secretary Can't Pronounce 'AI' Correctly
articles.author: David Moye
articles.summary: Linda McMahon, Donald Trump's secretary of education, made a mistake while speaking at the ASU+GSV Summit in San Diego on Tuesday. She referred to artificial intelligence (AI) as 'A1' instead of 'AI' several times. Social media users took to Twitter to mock her for the mistake.

articles.title: For Some Reason, Trump's Education Secretary Can't Pronounce 'AI' Correctly
articles.author: David Moye
articles.summary: Linda McMahon, Donald Trump's secretary of education, made a mistake when she spoke at the ASU+GSV Summit in San Diego on Tuesday. She mispronounced the word AI as 'A1' instead of 'A'. It's not the first time Linda McMahon has made such a mistake.

articles.title: Writer unveils ‘AI HQ' platform, betting on agents to transform enterprise work
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: Writer unveils AI HQ platform to transform enterprise work with autonomous agents that execute complex workflows across systems. Writer claims it can reduce workforce needs and deliver measurable ROI on AI investments for enterprises. Read more here: http://www.businessinsider.com/article/ai-hq-platform-to-transform-enterprise-work-with-autonomous-agents-that-execute-complex-workflows-from-systems-could-reduce-workforce-needs-and-deliver-measurable-ROI-on-AI-investments.

articles.title: Retailers have big questions about AI
articles.author: John Sabino
articles.summary: Retail is at a turning point. Consumers expect intelligent, seamless, and personalized experiences at every touchpoint. The right AI platform can stitch them together into a seamless journey. It's no longer just about efficiency, it's about impact. Successful retailers don't replace humans, they empower them.

articles.title: Best Free Website Builders for Fast, Code-Free Website Creation
articles.summary: Website builders are visual design tools that make it easy to create your own site in minutes. Site123 is the best free website builder thanks to its rapid AI site generation, excellent site editing tools and fast customer service. Webador is a powerful website builder with a lot of impressive features, including one of the most generous free plans.

articles.title: Writer unveils ‘AI HQ' platform, betting on agents to transform enterprise work
articles.summary: Writer is an enterprise AI software company with 160% net retention rate and $1.9 billion valuation. Its new product is agent-based AI that can solve complex business problems without human intervention. The enterprise AI market is expected to grow from $114 billion to $200 billion in the next few years.

articles.title: UPMC scientists receive $100K in pursuit of better breast cancer detection with AI
articles.author: Hanna Webster
articles.summary: The Pennsylvania Breast Cancer Coalition awarded $100,000 to Dr. Shandong Wu and his team to study how artificial intelligence can help predict breast cancer recurrence and identify optimal patients for a certain breast cancer treatment. Dr. Wu also won a $100k grant from the coalition in 2024.

articles.title: Binghamton University to establish AI institute – Central New York Business Journal
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: Binghamton University will establish an Institute for AI and Society. Eight SUNY campuses will share $5 million in state funding to develop departments, centers, and institutes of AI. They will use resources from Empire AI, a consortium of public and private universities building an artificial intelligence computing center at the University at Buffalo.

articles.title: Google invented new ways to alter movies with AI for The Sphere. It's sure to be controversial.
articles.author: Matt Binder
articles.summary: This summer, The Sphere in Las Vegas is going to debut a new experience: The Wizard of Oz at Sphere with the help of Google and AI. The Sphere has 580,000 square feet of LED displays wrapped around the venue. The inside of the one-of-a-kind venue also features wrap-around LED screens with an eye-popping 16K resolution. This year, it will show an existing movie for the first time, the classic 1939 film "Wizard of Oz" on the world's highest resolution LED screen. Google used generative AI models from its Gemini family to upscale the picture.

articles.title: Camp Infinity enhances tech skills in girls
articles.author: Terese Ledy
articles.summary: The week-long Camp Infinity introduces fifth through eighth grade girls to computer and internet technologies through hands-on activities. The registration deadline is in May, and there are limited spots available. The camp runs from July 21 – 25 at Northern Michigan University. It costs $125 for the full week, including meals.

articles.title: ChatGPT's memory can now reference all past conversations, not just what you tell it to
articles.summary: ChatGPT has added a new feature called Memory to let it 'naturally build' on previous conversations. The feature is available to ChatGPT Plus and Pro users only. It will be available to Enterprise, Team and Edu users later. Some users are concerned about how it might change how the AI model interacts with you.

articles.title: UPMC receives grant for AI based breast cancer research
articles.author: Shaylah Brown
articles.summary: PA Breast Cancer Coalition awarded a $100,000 research grant to two Pittsburgh-based researchers on Thursday morning to support a focus on AI in breast cancer research and breast cancer recurrence. Dr. Shandong Wu, professor of radiology at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine, will focus on using AI techniques that allow for deep learning models. The research will help patients understand their risk of recurrence after chemotherapy.

articles.title: ChatGPT can now remember everything you ever told it
articles.author: system
articles.summary: ChatGPT has got a boost to its memory capabilities. The bot can now remember any details a user has revealed in a chat. The goal is to make ChatGPT even more helpful.    - OpenAI, the company behind the technology.

articles.title: DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis says Google will eventually combine its Gemini and Veo AI models
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: Google plans to combine its Gemini AI models with its Veo video-generating models to improve the former's understanding of the physical world. AI industry is moving toward "omni" models that can understand and synthesize many forms of media. Google's newest Gemini models can generate audio, images and text, while OpenAI's default model in ChatGPT can natively create images.

articles.title: BPD: Scammers using AI to mimic targets, commit fraud
articles.author: Aaron McGuire
articles.summary: Ballinger Police Department warns citizens to be vigilant after reports that artificial intelligence was being used to mimic a target's voice for fraud. The department advised residents to follow a selection of security tips. In March 2025, the Runnels County Sheriff's Office warned residents about AI-powered scams.

articles.title: BPD: Scammers using AI to mimic targets, commit fraud
articles.author: Aaron McGuire
articles.summary: Ballinger Police Department has received reports that artificial intelligence was being used to mimic a target's voice for fraud. The department advised residents to follow a selection of security tips. In March 2025, the Runnels County Sheriff's Office warned residents about AI-powered scams after receiving reports that a scammer was using AI technology to claim that the target's daughter needed money from gift cards to be admitted into the hospital.

articles.title: James Cameron says the cost of blockbuster films needs to be cut in half, and AI is the answer
articles.summary: James Cameron has been outspoken about the growing prevalence of AI in the film-making process. He wants to integrate it into a VFX workflow to reduce the cost of big effects-heavy, CG-heavy blockbuster films. Cameron also talked about the opposition to using other people's work to train AI models.

articles.title: Cardiologist developing AI device to detect clogged arteries
articles.author: Kerry Firth
articles.summary: Dr. Thomas Haffey is developing a device that analyzes the sound waves from the carotid artery using artificial intelligence to detect blockages. He hopes to have a product in the next couple of years. It would take about five minutes to show a clinician how to use it.

articles.title: How to Run DeepSeek LLM Locally on Mac
articles.summary: DeepSeek is a powerful Chinese Large Language Model that has capabilities rivaling ChatGPT while having dramatically lower training costs. It is available for Mac users to run it locally on an Apple Silicon Mac with an M-series chip or better. You must have at least 10GB of available disk space. You can also use AI tools through your iPhone or iPad using various apps.

articles.title: What AI in Knowledge Management Means for Future HRIS Systems
articles.author: Alexander Hamilton
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence (AI) revolutionizes various industries, its impact on knowledge management within Human Resource Information Systems (HRIS) is becoming increasingly profound. AI-powered KM tools can automatically categorize HR policies, standard operating procedures, and employee records. They provide employees with personalized recommendations for learning and development opportunities based on historical data and individual career progression. They also play a pivotal role in streamlining HR operations by answering employee queries.

articles.title: Gro.X Redefines EdTech UX with Award-Winning Design for PrepAI
articles.summary: Gro.X has won a Davey Award for transforming PrepAI's website with a design that showcases how AI streamlines test creation for educators. PrepAI is an artificial intelligence-powered test generation platform developed by The Bertrand Education Group, a portfolio company of NewtekOne (Nasdaq: NEWT).

articles.title: Humach Buying AI-Based Financial Communications Platform Markets EQ
articles.author: Amit Chowdhry
articles.summary: Humach has acquired Markets EQ, a company that provides AI-powered voice analytics to Wall Street. Markets EQ will work as an independent and wholly owned subsidiary of Humach. Sean Austin will serve as Chief AI Officer, Daniel Shields as CFO and CTO Sam Debnath as VP of Engineering.

articles.title: US employs AI to analyze worker personnel files
articles.author: GREGORY KORTE
articles.summary: Office of Personnel Management will use artificial intelligence to clean up its personnel records this year. It follows government-wide guidance last week directing agencies to 'lean forward' on the use of the technology to improve services and cut costs. The White House has been reluctant to acknowledge the government's use of AI on sensitive federal data. Elon Musk's DOGE teams have scattered across the government.

articles.title: NETRAMARK TO HOST SHAREHOLDER CONFERENCE CALL TO DISCUSS BUSINESS MOMENTUM
articles.author: Netra Mark Holdings Inc
articles.summary: NetraMark Holdings Inc. is a premier artificial intelligence company that is transforming clinical trials with AI powered precision analytics in the pharmaceutical industry. It will host a shareholder conference call to provide an update on its recent strategic developments, commercial progress, regulatory initiatives and the next phase of its business growth.

articles.title: KEYNOTE ADDRESS BY HIS EXCELLENCY DR. JULIUS MAADA BIO PRESIDENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF SIERRA LEONE AT THE OPENING CEREMONY OF THE 10TH ORDINARY MEETING OF THE AFRICAN DIAMOND PRODUCERS' ASSOCIATION (ADPA) COUNCIL OF MINISTERS AND COMMITTEE OF EXPERTS AND THE OPENING OF THE SIERRA LEONE MINING WEEK AND EXHIBITION FREETOWN, SIERRA LEONE APRIL 10, 2025 (Government of the Republic of Sierra Leone)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: The URL to the PDF file must be on the same domain as the current web page to fetch the file. Click here for more info.   Share this story on Twitter and Facebook. Share this article on Twitter. Share it on Facebook. share it on LinkedIn.

articles.title: San Diego County seeks new policy to govern use of AI
articles.author: Jeff McDonald
articles.summary: The Board of Supervisors directed top officials to study what policy changes should be enacted to contend with AI. The county will start with general guidelines and develop a framework governing how AI will be employed across every aspect of county operations. The new framework will spell out how the county will deploy AI and, more specifically, how employees and constituents can be protected.

articles.title: OpenAI Countersues Musk Over Alleged Harassment
articles.author: Naveen Athrappully
articles.summary: OpenAI is suing Elon Musk, accusing him of harassing the artificial intelligence research company. In November, Musk filed a lawsuit against OpenAI. OpenAI was founded in December 2015 as a research lab, and Musk's involvement with the entity was 'short-lived' Musk had pledged $1 billion in donations to OpenAI, but that commitment was 'never satisfied'

articles.title: Adobe says we'll soon be able to chat with Photoshop
articles.author: Joe Foley
articles.summary: Adobe is planning to show off its new Actions panel with a 'creative agent' in it at MAX London later this month. The agent will be able to analyse your work, spot opportunities for improvements and recommend context-aware edits. The ultimate goal is to have a full natural language interface in which we can tell Photoshop what we want it to do.

articles.title: Microsoft ‘slowing or pausing' some AI data center projects
articles.author: Miranda Nazzaro
articles.summary: Microsoft is 'slowing or pausing' some of its data center projects. The company is still on track to spend more than $80 billion on infrastructure. Trump administration has pushed for more data center development to assist in the acceleration of AI technology. President Trump announced a private sector investment of $500 billion to build AI infrastructure.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman: Artificial General Intelligence 'is going to be everywhere'
articles.author: Nikki Ross
articles.summary: Sam Altman is the CEO and co-founder of OpenAI. He spoke at the Vanderbilt University's fourth annual Summit on Modern Conflict and Emerging Threats on April 10. He talked about AGI and what's next for his company in the year ahead.

articles.title: Google just unveiled its most powerful AI chip to-date
articles.author: Arthur Brown
articles.summary: Google has been developing its own AI chips for years. The processing units that the company uses are called TPUs (Tensor Processing Units). They are the building blocks to Google's AI. Google has just unveiled its 7th-gen AI chip architecture called Ironwood. This chip has more than 10 times the TFLops than TPU v5p and 192GB of memory.

articles.title: What is Meta AI and why is it in my WhatsApp?
articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.summary: There is a new option in WhatsApp that grants access to Meta AI. Some people are not happy with the news, but others are excited about it. What is Meta AI and why is it in WhatsApp's chat app? Tell us about it in the comments below.

articles.title: AI models still struggle to debug software, Microsoft study shows
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: Study from Microsoft Research shows that AI models from Anthropic and OpenAI's o3-mini fail to solve software development benchmark called SWE-bench Lite. Claude 3.7 Sonnet had the highest average success rate (48.4%), followed by Open AI's o1 (30.2%) and o3 -mini (22.1%).

articles.title: Adobe's Upcoming AI Chatbot Can Edit Your Photos for You in Photoshop
articles.author: Peta Pixel
articles.summary: At this point, nearly everyone is aware of artificial intelligence (AI) technology. AI technology is heavily featured in the latest movies and TV shows.      Â   i.e. "The Godfather" and "The Grand Budapest Hotel".

articles.title: AP Adds AI-Powered Search to Its Vast Content Library
articles.author: Peta Pixel
articles.summary: The Associated Press has introduced AI search to its content library to make it easier to discover and use its vast collection of visual, audio, and text content. The news and picture agency says it will make it more convenient to use its content and search.

articles.title: Mira Murati doubled the fundraising target for her new AI startup to $2 billion. It ...
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Mira Murati spent 6 years at OpenAI as the CTO working on ChatGPT. Her new company is building Thinking Machines Lab to make AI systems more widely understood, customizable and generally capable. Mira Murati will be speaking in San Francisco in December 2024.

articles.title: NPU Explained: Why Neural Processing Units Are the Future of AI
articles.author: Jon Martindale
articles.summary: NPU processors are revolutionizing device efficiency and speed. NPUs have been popping up in a range of devices for years, including Apple's iPhones and iPads, "Copilot+" PCs and laptops, and more. They are now appearing in recent consumer processors to accelerate local calculations of artificial intelligence (AI) software.

articles.title: Can Palantir Outperform NVIDIA, and Should You Buy the Stock?
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. shares have gained 21.5% this year, while NVIDIA's shares have fallen 15.1%. Palantir's revenues rose 36% in the fourth quarter, and it expects revenues to increase 31% year over year in the current year. The company has a Zacks Rank #3 (Strong Buy) and a PEG ratio of 0.85.

articles.title: Bridging Innovation and Execution: How Engineering Leaders Are Powering Business Growth – An Interview with Ronith Pingili
articles.author: David Quintero
articles.summary: Ronith Pingili is an engineer and business automation expert. He has worked extensively with Salesforce, which is a powerful tool for business automation. He believes that the future of automation will be AI-driven and deeply integrated across all business functions. He recommends starting with a clear strategy and a phased approach to implement automation.

articles.title: Elon Musk Wants To 'Harm' OpenAI Because He Can't Stand Its Success Without Him: Lawsuit
articles.author: Pocharapon Neammanee
articles.summary: Sam Altman filed a countersuit against his OpenAI co-founder Elon Musk on Wednesday. Altman and Musk co-founded the artificial intelligence company in 2015. Musk left the company three years later and accused Altman of diverging from the original mission by partnering with Microsoft and keeping its advanced tech for private consumers. The countersuit claims Musk did everything he could to harm the company.

articles.title: Amazon (AMZN) Price Target Slashed by Investment Bank, But Bullish Outlook Maintained
articles.author: Larry Ramer
articles.summary: Piper Sandler cut its price target on Amazon to $215 from $265 but kept an Overweight rating on the name. Piper expects the tech giant to provide upbeat guidance when it reports its first-quarter results within the next few weeks. Analysts expect the company's 2025 earnings per share to come in at $6.32, up from $5.53 in 2024.

articles.title: Bug Hunts Are Over: Smarter, Faster QA with AI/ML
articles.author: David Quintero
articles.summary: Software testing costs nearly a quarter of an organization's annual IT budget. AI is changing the face of quality assurance and test automation. Raghavender Reddy Vanam is a Senior QA Automation Engineer. He has over a decade of experience spanning automation frameworks, cloud-based QA solutions and AI-driven testing strategies.

articles.title: How might AI chatbots replace mental health therapists?
articles.author: Joel Mathis
articles.summary: There's a shortage of mental health care providers in the United States. New research suggests that AI chatbots can be remarkably effective while delivering mental health therapy with as much efficacy as or more than human clinicians. There are concerns about privacy and the "human-to-human connection" that makes therapy effective.

articles.title: Who is Jay Woods? From football to farming this Alabama native is out for love on reality TV
articles.author: Jennifer Lindahl
articles.summary: Jay Woods is one of four farmers on the new season of Farmer Wants a Wife. He played college football for both the University of Michigan and Duke University. His football career was cut short by injury and he now works as a hay and cattle farmer on 515 acres of land in Alabama.

articles.title: ChatGPT can now remember everything you ever told it
articles.author: lvaranasi@businessinsider.com
articles.summary: ChatGPT just got a major upgrade to its memory. The bot can now remember any details a user has revealed in a chat. The new feature is rolling out today to ChatGPT Plus and Pro users except those in select countries, including the UK, Switzerland, Norway, and Iceland. ChatGpt Team, Enterprise, and Edu users will have access to the new feature in a few weeks.

articles.title: ChatGPT can now remember everything you ever told it
articles.author: Lakshmi Varanasi
articles.summary: ChatGPT has added 100 million users in two months and 20 million paid subscribers. New memory capabilities for ChatGPT are rolling out to all Plus and Pro users except in the EEA, UK, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein. Team, Enterprise, and Edu users will get access to the new feature in a few weeks.

articles.title: OpenAI hits back with lawsuit against Elon Musk
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: OpenAI has accused Elon Musk of harassment and asking a federal judge to block any further unlawful and unfair action against the company as part of an ongoing legal battle. Musk has been engaged in a legal battle with OpenAI for over a year, accusing it of deviating from its original mission of developing AI for public good rather than profit. OpenAI's legal team responded to a $97.4 billion unsolicited takeover bid earlier this year from a Musk-led consortium.

articles.title: What Can AI Smart Glasses Do That Your Phone Can't?
articles.author: Marty Spargo
articles.summary: AI smart glasses integrate artificial intelligence into daily life. They offer real-time assistance, augmented reality, and instant information access. It's a new way to connect with the world and a hands-free digital experience that smartphones can't match. It is not just about smartphones anymore.

articles.title: Check out Samsung's AI Content Upscaling on New 8K Neo QLED Smart TV Now
articles.author: Jessica Fritsch
articles.summary: The 65-inch Class Neo QLED 8K QN900F Vision AI Smart TV is now available for purchase at Samsung.com. It has an 8K resolution of 7,680 x 4,320 pixels and a 120Hz refresh rate. The TV is equipped with the NQ8 AI Gen2 processor.

articles.title: World's first baby conceived by sperm-injecting robot is born – thanks to AI-operated machine
articles.author: The Sun
articles.summary: The world's first baby conceived by a sperm-injecting robot has been born. A 40-year-old woman who'd struggled to get pregnant through IVF gave birth to the tot with the helping hand of an AI-operated machine. The doctor is tired and distracted sometimes, which can reduce the odds of fertilisation and births.

articles.title: The US Secretary of Education referred to AI as 'A1,' like the steak sauce
articles.author: Amanda Silberling
articles.summary: U.S. Secretary of Education Linda McMahon attended the ASU+GSV Summit this week. She was speaking on a panel about AI in the workforce. She referred to artificial intelligence as "A1" at first, but then she became less consistent.

articles.title: OpenAI supercharges ChatGPT memory in major leap toward AGI — Now remembers everything, and feels almost human
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: ChatGPT has just got a memory upgrade. It can now reference all of your chat history to respond more naturally and understand your preferences. The update starts rolling out on April 10 to ChatGPT Plus and Pro users except in EEA, UK, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein.

articles.title: UBS Remains Bullish on Walmart (WMT) Despite Tariffs
articles.author: Larry Ramer
articles.summary: Walmart (WMT) is executing well and has a good management team, according to UBS. UBS trimmed its price target on WMT to $110 from $112 but kept a Buy rating on the name. WMT is seeking to increase its revenue by up to 4% this year and the growth of its operating income by 5.5%. However, tariffs could hurt WMT's profits.

articles.title: A mouse watched YouTube. Then scientists mapped a tiny piece of its brain.
articles.author: Karissa Waddick
articles.summary: Scientists have created the largest functional map of a brain to date. The data set contains 84,000 neurons, 500 million synapses and neuronal wiring that could extend the length of New York's Central Park nearly one and a half times. The project offers unprecedented insight into the brain's function and organization that could help unlock the secrets of intelligence. Scientists believe it could eventually lead to the discovery of medications for brain disorders like Alzheimer's and Parkinson's disease.

articles.title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy may have agreed to what Google's Sundar Pichai said on investing billions in AI
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Andy Jassy, CEO of Amazon, has defended the company's significant investment on the development of artificial intelligence (AI) technologies in his annual letter to shareholders. He believes that such investment is crucial for Amazon's mission to make customers' lives better and easier every day.

articles.title: Workday Chief People Officer Ashley Goldsmith on Leading Through Change
articles.author: Aman Kidwai
articles.summary: Ashley Goldsmith is the chief people officer at a company whose clients are in the same role. She discusses the role of emerging machine-learning tools and automation in the workplace and new ways of approaching recruiting, talent strategy, and productivity in today's fast-changing times.

articles.title: AI-powered martech news and releases: April 10
articles.author: Constantine von Hoffman
articles.summary: President Trump's now-paused tariffs are rattling consumers. A drop in their spending would be bad for Meta and Google, both major AI builders. Microsoft and Amazon are planning to spend $325 billion next year on data centers. AI hasn't been profitable for anyone yet.

articles.title: OpenAI Introduces New Program Aimed at Evaluating Domain-Specific AI Benchmarks
articles.author: Mark Mwachiro
articles.summary: The OpenAI Pioneers Program is aimed at developing domain-specific evaluations of reliable artificial intelligence language models. The company honed in on industries such as legal, finance, insurance, healthcare, and accounting that need proper evaluations. Findings from the evaluations will be published at a later date.

articles.title: Thinking Machines Lab seeking to raise $2B at near $10B valuation: report
articles.summary: Thinking Machines Lab is raising $2B in new funding for its artificial intelligence startup. The amount is double what the company was seeking less than two months ago. Mira Murati, a former OpenAI CTO, started Thinking Machines Lab in February. John Schulman, who co-founded ChatGPT in 2015, and Barret Zoph, who left OpenAI in September, will be its CTO.

articles.title: How Uber Freight is leveraging AI to make truck routes more efficient
articles.summary: Trucking industry leaders want to minimize empty-trailer trips to improve costs and efficiency. Uber Freight is using AI on its platform to provide trucking companies with more optimized routes. The technology could cut a truck's empty rate to as low as 10%.

articles.title: ‘It's cathartic': Meet the men turning to ChatGPT for dating advice — and discover what it means for your relationships
articles.author: Arielle Domb
articles.summary: ChatGPT has over 400 million weekly users and 122.6 million people use it daily. Men are three times more likely than women to use it for relationship advice. Dr Sophie Mort is a clinical psychologist and author of Unstuck. She is optimistic about the rise of AI chatbots for emotional processing around relationships.

articles.title: Ericsson unveils AI-led enterprise wireless-first branch architecture
articles.author: Computer Weekly
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence-supported infrastructures are increasingly deployed to bring efficiency and productivity benefits for AI-led enterprise innovation. They are also needed to meet the challenges of delivering agile, secure connectivity for AI led innovation.   Â  .

articles.title: Thread by @quxiaoyin on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Xiaoyin Qu got replaced by AI that lets you create a website, app, or game in 9 minutes. It's led by AstraPrimeAI, the world's 1st AI-run dev agency 100x faster and 10x cheaper than a developer.

articles.title: NTT launches physics of AI group and AI inference chip design for 4K video
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: NTT Research has started a new AI basic research group, dubbed the Physics of Artificial Intelligence Group. It will focus on AI research in the field of physics and artificial intelligence. The group will work on the development of artificial intelligence systems and their control over naturalistic intelligence.

articles.title: ChatGPT just got a huge memory upgrade — here's why it's a big deal
articles.author: Amanda Caswell
articles.summary: ChatGPT is getting a major upgrade to its memory features. CEO Sam Altman had a hard time sleeping last night because he was excited about it. New features are rolling out to ChatGPT Plus and Pro users globally except in the UK, EU, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland. OpenAI plans to extend access to Enterprise, Team, and EDU users next.

articles.title: Canva is getting AI image generation, interactive coding, spreadsheets and more
articles.author: Ivan Mehta
articles.summary: Canva is adding a suite of new AI features to its platform, including an AI assistant, the ability to create apps with prompts, support for spreadsheets, and AI-powered editing tools. Canva laid off some technical writing staff earlier this month, nine months after its co-founders asked employees to use AI apps.

articles.title: LiveKit's tools power real-time communications, including OpenAI's Voice Mode
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Russ d'Sa and David Zhao created LiveKit, an open-source software package for building apps that can transmit real-time audio and video. LiveKit now has more than 500 paying customers and over 100,000 developers. Its customers include tech giants Spotify, Meta, and Microsoft, as well as Character AI, Speak, and Fanatics.

articles.title: Trump's Education Secretary Kept Calling AI ‘A1' During Conference Discussion
articles.author: Ahmad Austin Jr.
articles.summary: Linda McMahon used the wrong term for AI in a speech at the ASU+GSV Summit in San Diego this week. She was nominated by President Donald Trump to lead the Department of Education. She referred to AI as 'A1' multiple times during the speech.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley Is Bearish on Carnival (CCL), Royal Caribbean (RCL)
articles.author: Larry Ramer
articles.summary: Morgan Stanley upgraded Carnival Corporation to Equal Weight from Underweight and cut its price target on Royal Caribbean Cruises to $220 from $270. Stifel remains bullish on RCL and lowered its target to $265 from $310, but kept a Buy rating.

articles.title: US engineers' AI converts simple text into walking robots in a day
articles.author: Kapil Kajal
articles.summary: Text2Robot is a generative AI framework that converts natural language commands directly into functional, physically manufactured robotic systems. It will be presented at the IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation in May 2025 in Atlanta, Georgia. It earned first place in the innovation category of the 2024 Virtual Creatures Competition held during the Artificial Life conference in Copenhagen.

articles.title: Report reveals behind-the-scenes drama over fake Siri demo at WWDC 2024
articles.author: The Information
articles.summary: The new Siri with on-screen awareness capabilities is expected to be released sometime in 2026. John Giannandrea's team was responsible for making Siri better, while Craig Federighi's teams were doing all the hard work. The report also gives us another point of view on Apple's.

articles.title: These two things are the biggest giveaway of an AI generated picture
articles.author: Usatoday
articles.summary: Images generated by artificial intelligence can be seen by anyone using a computer program.   Â. Â ÂÂ   y. Youtube.com/ArtificialIntelligence can be used to generate such images.  Yfrog.com

articles.title: Mira Murati doubled the fundraising target for her new AI startup to $2 billion. It could be the largest seed round in history.
articles.author: Ben Bergman
articles.summary: Thinking Machines is raising $2 billion in venture funding. That's double what Murati was seeking less than two months ago. The new valuation Murati is seeking is not clear, though two people said it's at least $10 billion. Murati spent 6 years at OpenAI, where she worked on the development of ChatGPT and AI research initiatives.

articles.title: AI helps reduce doctor burnout and address the shortage crisis
articles.author: Saima Khan
articles.summary: According to the American Medical Association, physician burnout could lead to a shortage of up to 124,000 doctors by 2034. About 66% of physicians surveyed in 2024 reported using AI in their practice. A survey from Ohio State Wexner Medical Center found Americans support doctors using AI for tasks like documentation. Dr. Colleen Reidy uses a tool that listens in on her conversations with patients and automatically transcribes them into medical notes.

articles.title: Text2Robot platform leverages generative AI to design and deliver functional robots with just a few spoken words
articles.author: Duke University
articles.summary: Text2Robot is a new computational robot design framework developed by engineers at Duke University. It allows anyone to design and build a robot simply by typing a few words describing what it should look like and how it should function.
